Class Piece

java.lang.Object
pieces.Piece
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
public abstract class Piece extends Object
Abstract base class for all chess pieces. Defines common attributes and methods that all chess pieces share.

  • Constructor Details

    • Piece

      public Piece(String color, int row, int col)
      Constructs a new piece with the specified color and position.
      Parameters:
      color - The color of the piece ("white" or "black").
      row - The initial row position (0-7).
      col - The initial column position (0-7).

  • Method Details

    • getColor

      public String getColor()
      Gets the color of this piece.
      Returns:
      The piece color ("white" or "black").

    • getRow

      public int getRow()
      Gets the current row position of this piece.
      Returns:
      The row position (0-7).

    • getCol

      public int getCol()
      Gets the current column position of this piece.
      Returns:
      The column position (0-7).

    • setPosition

      public void setPosition(int row, int col)
      Sets the position of this piece.
      Parameters:
      row - The new row position (0-7).
      col - The new column position (0-7).

    • possibleMoves

      public abstract List<int[]> possibleMoves(Piece[][] board)
      Calculates all possible moves for this piece from its current position. This method must be implemented by each concrete piece class.
      Parameters:
      board - The current board state.
      Returns:
      A list of possible moves, where each move is represented as [row, col].

    • isValidPosition

      protected boolean isValidPosition(int row, int col)
      Checks if a position is within the board boundaries.
      Parameters:
      row - The row to check.
      col - The column to check.
      Returns:
      true if the position is valid, false otherwise.

    • canMoveTo

      protected boolean canMoveTo(Piece[][] board, int row, int col)
      Checks if a square is empty or contains an enemy piece.
      Parameters:
      board - The game board.
      row - The row to check.
      col - The column to check.
      Returns:
      true if the square is empty or contains an enemy piece, false otherwise.

    • isEnemyPiece

      protected boolean isEnemyPiece(Piece[][] board, int row, int col)
      Checks if a square contains an enemy piece.
      Parameters:
      board - The game board.
      row - The row to check.
      col - The column to check.
      Returns:
      true if the square contains an enemy piece, false otherwise.

    • isEmpty

      protected boolean isEmpty(Piece[][] board, int row, int col)
      Checks if a square is empty.
      Parameters:
      board - The game board.
      row - The row to check.
      col - The column to check.
      Returns:
      true if the square is empty, false otherwise.
